definition: The activity of setting up and running a business, taking on financial risks in the hope of profit.
The introduction of something new or the development and application of new ideas, products, or methods.
The action or business of promoting and selling products or services, including market research and advertising.
A plan of action designed to achieve a long-term or overall aim.
The action of leading a group of people or an organization, or the ability to do this.
The total income generated by a company, typically measured over a set period.
A financial gain, especially the difference between the amount earned and the amount spent in buying, operating, or producing something.
The branch of knowledge concerned with the production, consumption, and transfer of wealth.
An assessment of the factors affecting the demand and supply of a particular product or service in a market.
The sequence of processes involved in the production and distribution of a commodity.
